intro: Stillingia chamaelea, commonly known as creeping stillingia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Stillingia chamaelea thrives in moist, woodland soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments.
